Callbacks: This class demonstrates how to implement a callback to perform an action on an object (Callee) through an external object (Caller) that maintains a reference to the former object (Callee). In this case, a stupid Incrementable interface is defined. The Callee object implements this interface directly, but also defines a private member inner class (Closure) that also implements this interface and a public method that returns a reference to this closure. The Caller object maintains a reference to an Incrementable implementation that can be used to increment the external object when needed.
The classes include simple runners that can be executed as java program.
